intro: Storckiella australiensis, commonly known as the Australian storckia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale blue flowers during the spring and summer months. Storckiella australiensis is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in heathlands and shrublands.
